title: Epitaph for Herennia Polla
support: Rectangular plaque of grey stone, complete. All edges original and complete. Rear is flat. Modern red paint on sides.

layout.p: Three lines of Latin text, centred on stone. Interpuncts are all slightly different from each other, but shaped (roughly) like horizontal commas, and notably placed at line beginnings and ends as well as between words. Although Bivona (1994) claims that there are traces of guidelines, these are not visible upon autopsy.

handNote.lettering: Most letters have a broad fairly square module and are regular, with simple straight line serifs. Text is rendered in straight lines. Incision of letters is not particularly deep.

provenanceFound._: Found in excavations in the house of Sig. De Michele, barone di S. Giuseppe, Termini Imerese, 1877. According to the editors of NSA, it was discovered with .

provenanceObserved._: Antoniou, 2023-07-04. In the Depositi of Museo Civico Baldassare Romano, room 1, scaffold 7, shelf 1.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2023-07-04.

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)

bibl.title: Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae
